meanings.definition: A substance that is being drawn out or removed from a mixture.
meanings.sent1: The educt in the experiment was carefully separated from the other components.
meanings.sent2: The scientist analyzed the educt to understand its properties.
meanings.sent3: The educt decided it was time to leave the mixture and explore the world outside.
meanings.sent4: The educt was like a curious explorer venturing into the unknown territory of the mixture.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the educt made it stand out among the dull mixture.

meanings.definition: To draw out or remove a substance from a mixture.
meanings.sent1: She carefully educted the impurities from the solution.
meanings.sent2: The machine was designed to efficiently educt the desired compound.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to educt the excess salt from the soup, making it perfect.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to educt a sense of calmness in the tense situation.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner worked like a charm to educt all the dust from the carpet.
